decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policy B1, Replacement UDP Policy 4.1. | The flat roof to be created shall not be used to form a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area.  REASON:	To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, H33, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 5.5, 5.9. | The extension permitted shall not be used or occupied at any time other than for purposes ancillary to the residential use of the dwelling known as 27 Towney Mead, Northolt.  REASON:	To ensure that the character of the area is preserved and a separate dwelling is not created, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, H8, H26, T50, T63, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 5.5, 5.6, 5.9, 9.1. | The proposed bedroom in the north elevation of the extension approved shall contain only obscure glass, and shall be fixed shut.  A sample of the obscured glass, no smaller than 300 mm square shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development, and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the sample thus approved.  The details so approved shall be retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policy H33, Replacement UDP Policy 5.9.
description: Two storey side and ground floor rear and side/rear extension to house
